Buildout¶

Buildout is a Python-based build system for creating, assembling and deploying applications from multiple parts, some of which may be non-Python-based. It lets you create a buildout configuration and reproduce the same software later. (http://www.buildout.org/)

We have four configurations for different purposes:

  • base.cfg
  • buildout.cfg
  • production.cfg

Base configuration¶

This is a base configuration, which contains all dependencies from different repositories, script generators.

Contents:

  • Mr. Developer extension
  • Python interpreter
  • Sphinx configuration
  • Shell commands

Code from repository is not stable, so we use it on our own risk.

Mr. Developer extension¶

sources-dir = parts
auto-checkout =
    django-audit-log
    django-mailer
    django-logicaldelete
    pyqrcode
    django-google-analytics
    django-ajax-selects

Where recipe determines buildout recipe, which fetches code from repository, then builds package, installs dependencies.

Python interpreter¶

This part is used for collecting all dependencies and creating proper PYTHONPATH.

[interpreter]
recipe = zc.recipe.egg
eggs =  
    ${buildout:eggs}
interpreter = python
scripts = python

Django recipes¶

We use special buildout recipe to fetch django and create manage and wsgi scripts.

There are two parts with different settings.

[instance]
recipe        = djangoprojectrecipe
python        = interpreter
eggs          = ${interpreter:eggs}
#projectegg    = ets
settings      = ets.settings
wsgi          = true
#test          = ets

This part downloads django 1.3, uses dependencies from Python interpreter, creates script instance, which acts like usual manage. It creates a script instance.wsgi.

Sphinx¶

[sphinx]
recipe = collective.recipe.sphinxbuilder
interpreter = export DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=ets.dev_settings; ${buildout:directory}/bin/python
script-name = make-docs
source = ${buildout:directory}/docs
build = ${buildout:directory}/docs/_build
outputs = 
      html

Use script make-docs to create or update documentation. Built docs will be stored in docs/_build folder.

Shell commands¶

    # Create DB relations and migrate them
    ./bin/instance syncdb --noinput --migrate --database=default
    ./bin/instance loaddata groups --database=default    
    ./bin/instance loaddata permissions --database=default
    
    #Collect static files
    ./bin/instance collectstatic --noinput --link

Development configuration¶

This configuration file used in development.

To inherit Development configuration:

[buildout]
extends = base.cfg

PyDev configuration¶

If you use Eclipse IDE, this configuration will be useful for you. It contains special recipe:

parts = ${buildout:base-parts}
        pydev

[pydev]
recipe = pb.recipes.pydev
eggs = ${buildout:eggs}

This part registers all eggs and extra paths in eclipse project.

Production configuration¶

This configurations sets up production environment.

Couple of thing we do:

  • append egg psycopg2
  • do check new versions of eggs
  • do not unzip eggs
  • install redis
  • create wsgi script
